item.title: OKC Council modifies panhandling ord, prepares to end color events
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Also hears reports about Streetcar and Draper Lake Trails progress The City of Oklahoma City Council voted unanimously to modify the controversial panhandling ordinance passed December 2015. The changed ordinance allows for activities such as collecting money on medians if the speed limit on the street where the activity is taking place is below 40 […]

The post OKC Council modifies panhandling ord, prepares to end color events appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Controversial median ordinance up for modification Tuesday
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The original proposal to limit panhandling or other activities in City of Oklahoma City street medians generated controversy before the city council passed it December 2015. The Municipal Counselors Office introduced modifications at the Oct. 24 council meeting. The council is set to vote on the modifications Tuesday. Organizations like Curbside Chronicle opposed the original […]

The post Controversial median ordinance up for modification Tuesday appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
